result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Joseph Ploeckelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall attend the next OWI victim impact panel scheduled for October 1, 2015.   Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall submit to an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

judgments.dispoDesc: The State moved for and was granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of one year.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the charge.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs are added on to defendant's current payment plan of $50.00 a month.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin no later than August 11, 2016 at 4:30 pm.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Joseph Ploeckelman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Jason Joseph Ploeckelman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds that Mr. Ploeckelman waived his right to an attorney at his original sentencing.  No statement by defendant.  Court adjudicates defendant guilty  and orders 5 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than August 11, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  Unpaid court costs are reduced to a civil judgment.  Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  The costs shall be added to defendant's current payment plan.  - rt

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Jason Joseph Ploeckelman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 1 to possession of controlled substance 961.41(3g)(b).  Plea of no contest.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court accepts conditional discharge of Count 1 and orders probation for one year with conditional discharge contrary to 961.47; conditions; AODA and $50.00 service of process fees; court costs; attend OWI victim impact panel.    Upon successful completion defendant may be discharged from probation and case will be dismissed. - rt

Defendant Jason Joseph Ploeckelman not in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not served with the complaint.  Attorney Tlusty would like the June 18, 2015 removed from the calendar.  Adjourn the initial appearance to June 30, 2015 at 1: 00 p.m.  - rt
